admire.definition: To look at something or someone with pleasure and respect
admire.example: I admire how hard you work on your homework

brisk.example: We took a brisk walk to warm up on the cold morning

curious.definition: Wanting to know or learn about something
curious.example: The curious cat peeked inside the box

dazzle.definition: To amaze or impress someone greatly
dazzle.example: The fireworks dazzle everyone at the celebration

eager.definition: Very excited and interested to do something
eager.example: The eager students raised their hands to answer

fragile.example: Handle the fragile glass vase carefully

glimpse.definition: A quick or brief look at something
glimpse.example: I caught a glimpse of the rainbow before it faded

humble.example: She stayed humble even after winning the award

mingle.definition: To mix together or socialize with others
mingle.example: The students mingle during recess time

timid.example: The timid puppy hid behind its owner

abandon.definition: To leave something behind or give up on it
abandon.example: Don't abandon your dreams even when things get hard

benefit.definition: Something helpful or good that you get
benefit.example: Exercise has many benefits for your health

capture.definition: To catch or take control of something
capture.example: The photographer tried to capture the perfect sunset

declare.definition: To say something officially or clearly
declare.example: The teacher will declare the winner tomorrow

enormous.example: The elephant was enormous compared to the mouse

fiction.definition: Stories that are made up, not real
fiction.example: Harry Potter is a popular work of fiction

genuine.example: Her genuine smile showed she was truly happy

harmony.definition: When things work well together; agreement
harmony.example: The choir sang in perfect harmony

inspire.definition: To make someone want to do something good
inspire.example: Great teachers inspire their students to learn

journey.definition: A trip from one place to another
journey.example: Our family took a journey across the country

kindness.example: One act of kindness can brighten someone's day

liberty.definition: Freedom to do what you want
liberty.example: The Statue of Liberty represents freedom

mystery.definition: Something that is secret or hard to understand
mystery.example: The detective tried to solve the mystery

noble.example: Helping others is a noble thing to do

observe.definition: To watch carefully or notice something
observe.example: Scientists observe nature to learn about animals

quest.definition: A long search for something important
quest.example: The knight went on a quest to find treasure

rapid.example: The rabbit made a rapid escape from the fox

simple.definition: Easy to understand or do; not complicated
simple.example: The math problem was simple enough for everyone

triumph.example: Winning the championship was a triumph for the team

unique.definition: One of a kind; unlike anything else
unique.example: Every snowflake is unique in its pattern

valiant.example: The valiant firefighter rushed into the burning building

wisdom.definition: Knowledge and good judgment about life
wisdom.example: Grandparents often share their wisdom with us

excellence.example: She achieved excellence in her piano performance

yearning.definition: A strong wish or desire for something
yearning.example: There was a yearning in her heart to see the ocean

zealous.example: The zealous fans cheered loudly for their team
